description: A stone-built house, showing activity from the 1st to 3rd CE. The building produced a large amount of Roman material as well as some unusual features, such as a round 'table', and a triangular box. The building has been interpreted as a shrine.
bibliography: Butcher. “Roman Nornour, Isles of Scilly: A Reconsideration.” Cornish Archaeology 39–40 (2001).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Nornour (Cornwall).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
